story.text: TORONTO Jan 3 Inco shareholders N.TO voted on Wednesday to seal the takeover by Brazil's Companhia Vale do Rio Doce (VALE5.SA) (RIO.N), taking a mining sector icon out of Canadian hands. CVRD, the biggest iron ore producer in the world, has already taken control of Inco and holds about 87.8 percent of Inco's outstanding shares. Inco had called a meeting for shareholders to consider a transaction by way of amalgamation, a legal procedure so that CVRD could take up 100 percent of the nickel producer.
story.title: shareholders seal crvd ' s takeover of inco
